query: What are the main tracks of the WWW2023 conference?
output: The main tracks of the WWW2023 conference include the Web and Society Track, the Systems and Infrastructure for Web, Mobile Web, and Web of Things Track, the Web Mining and Content Analysis Track, and the Semantics and Knowledge Track.

query: Are there any hotel recommendations for attendees of the WWW2023 conference?
output: Yes, the WWW2023 conference has room blocks at the AT&T Hotel and Conference Center offering discounted rates for attendees. Another recommendation is the Hilton Garden Inn Austin University Capitol District.

query: What is the price for just registering for the virtual conference?

- For ACM Members it is $300
- For WebSci Only and Student, it is $100.

query: What are the titles of the keynotes in this conference?
output: The titles of the keynotes in this conference are "Decolonizing Creative Labor in the age of AI", "Using diversity as a source of scientific innovation for the Web", and "GNNs and Graph Generative models for biomedical applications."

query: What are the major topics that will be discussed in the WWW2023 conference sessions?
output: The major topics that will be discussed in the WWW2023 conference sessions include inequalities in the face of concurrent crises with a focus on social machines, crowd computing and collective intelligence, health and well-being online, and globalisation trends in the Web. Other topics include privacy-preserving online content moderation, challenges in accessing large-scale structured datasets, and fairness, accountability, transparency, and ethics on the Web.

query: What is the policy for professional conduct or behavior for attendees?
output: The policy for professional conduct or behavior for attendees is adherence to the ACM Code of Ethics and ACM Policy Against Harassment. Unacceptable behavior includes sexual harassment, racism, homophobia, and any other behavior that discriminates against a group or class of people. Participants should agree that such behavior will constitute grounds for actions against them. If any attendee is involved in or witnesses any such incident, they are asked to inform the event organizers.

query: Does the WWW2023 conference offer any travel grants for participants?
output: Yes, the WWW2023 conference offers travel grants for participants. The WebSci’23 travel grants provide support up to $1,500 for students, early career scholars, and presenters from underrepresented regions who have an accepted paper at the conference and apply by March 26, 2023. There's also a separate Zhipu Student Travel Awards for full-time students planning to attend the conference in-person.

query: Is there a policy for professional conduct or behavior for attendees?
output: Yes, there is a policy for professional conduct or behavior for attendees at The Web Conference 2023 and the Web Science Conference 2023. Both adhere to the ACM Code of Ethics and ACM Policy Against Harassment. Behavior such as racism, homophobia, sexual harassment, and any other behavior that discriminates against a group or class of people constitutes grounds for action against the participant. If attendees are involved in or witness any such incident, they are encouraged to inform the event organizers.

query: What is the event program for Sunday April 30 at the WWW2023 conference?
output: The event program for Sunday, April 30 at the WWW2023 conference includes various workshops and special events. Some events, sponsored by Web Science, take place at different locations at the AT&T Hotel and Conference Center. The detailed timings for the events are from 9:00 AM to 5:00 PM, with one event ending at 12:30 PM and another starting at 1:30 PM. Some of the events include WebSci and W4A.

query: Who are the organizers behind WWW2023 conference?
output: The organizers behind the WWW2023 conference are coordinated by SIGweb. For the satellite event Web Sci2023, the organizing committee includes Program Chairs from Illinois, General Chairs from the University of Southampton and Northwestern University, and Program Committee Members from various affiliations such as Guanghua Chi from University of California, Berkeley; Andrej Kastrin from University of Ljubljana; Ashiqur Khudabukhsh from Carnegie Mellon University; and Kazuhiro Kazama from Wakayama University. The workshop at the conference is organized by Markus Strohmaier.

query: How can I contact the WWW2023 research track chairs?

query: what requests are needed for visa letter?
output: For a visa support letter, the following information needs to be included in the request: your name as it appears on your passport, your current postal mailing address, the name of the conference you are registering for, your registration confirmation number. If you have any papers accepted for the conference, you should provide the title and indicate whether you are the “sole author” or a “co-author”. If you don't have a paper, speakers can provide the title of their presentation. All requests should be referred to supportletters@acm.org.

query: How to Apply for the Virtual Participation Award?
output: To apply for the Virtual Participation Award, you need to submit the following materials in a single PDF file: your CV which includes your full name and email address, a short statement (1-2 paragraphs) explaining your interest in participating in The Web Conference 2023, and evidence of your eligibility such as a valid student ID, a letter from your supervisor, or your profile page on your university's website. The application must be submitted by April 20, 2023 (AoE). For any questions, you can email thewebconf23fairaccess@easychair.org. Submit your application at the following link: https://easychair.org/conferences/?conf=webconf23fairaccess.

query: How to apply for the student travel award
output: To apply for the Zhipu Student Travel Award for the 2023 ACM The Web Conference, you need to submit certain documents as a single PDF file. These documents include a CV, which should detail your current status including the institution where you study, the type of study (undergraduate, MS, or PhD), and the number of years you've been in your current program. You also need to submit a recommendation letter from your advisor. The letter should confirm that you are a student in good standing, describe how you will benefit from attending the conference, and explain why you are in need of the travel award, and whether there is funding available to cover expenses that the award doesn't cover. Be sure to submit your application by the deadline on March 31, 2023. It should also be noted that while all students can apply, preference will be given to those presenting papers or posters at the conference. For co-authored papers, only the first author can apply unless they are unable to attend the conference.

query: What details should be included in the 'Tutorial proposals' for the WWW2023 conference?
output:
The 'Tutorial proposals' for the WWW2023 conference should include the following details:

1. Audience: A description of the intended audience, prerequisite knowledge, and the expected learning outcomes.

2. Style and Duration: An indication whether this will be a lecture-style or hands-on tutorial. If it's the latter, the equipment needs for participants should be indicated (e.g., pre-installed Jupyter notebook with specific packages).

3. Tutorial organization: The proposal should feature in-depth hands-on training on cutting-edge systems and tools of relevance to the Web Conference community. It should target novice as well as moderately-skilled users and focus on providing hands-on experience. Proposals should introduce the motivation behind the tool, associated fundamental concepts, work through examples, demonstrate its application to real-life use cases, and the pace of the tutorial should be adequate for beginners. Additionally, each hands-on tutorial must include at least 30 minutes of time allocated for Q&A sessions.
